page.title: 05Cupar Housing
page.content: In Cupar's inner-town area lie the buildings from the Victorian/Edwardian era and are either villas or terraced houses and consist of "A" and "B"{ {class housing.}In the C.B.D. the{ {housing}is mostly flats and is "B" to "C"{class housing.}A modern development in house building in Cupar has been the construction of{sheltered {housing}for the elderly. There are three sites in the town _ two of which are owned by the Council; Bathgate Court and Winthank Court.The most recent site at Westport, still under construction, is for private retirement homes. Another recent development in{housing in Cupar is the sale of{council {houses.}Up to 30% of{council house} stock have been sold to their occupiers in the past three years.
